data.title: About Tennessee Tech
data.meta_description: Tennessee Tech University ranked as the #1 public university in TN, according to Money magazine, and best return on investment. 200+ programs in Engineering, Education, Business, and more.
data.text:
Facts and Figures

Enrollment

All enrollment numbers from Fall 2023 census.

Total Student Body: 10,117

Undergraduate students: 8,838

Graduate students: 1,279

In-State students: 91.1%

Out-of-State students: 8.9%

International students: 3.3%

Student Body

Undergraduate Students Graduate Students Female 46% 59% Male 54% 41% Part-time 11% 76%

Academics

Average Incoming ACT score: 23.7

Student-to-Faculty Ratio: 18:1

Faculty (Fall 2022): 599 (headcount); 436 full-time (337 tenured/tenure-track, 99 non-tenure track); 163 adjunct (54 FTE)

Top 10 Undergraduate Programs by Enrollment: Computer Science; Mechanical Engineering; Biology; Nursing; Business Management; Exercise Science; Civil & Environmental Engineering; Psychology; Elementary Education; Electrical Engineering

Top 5 Graduate Programs by Enrollment: Curriculum & Instruction (M.A.), Business Administration (M.B.A.), Engineering (Ph.D.), Nursing (M.S.N.), Professional Studies (M.P.S.)

Fall-to-fall retention rate for first-time freshmen, 2022 to 2023: 77.3%

Six-year graduation rate for first-time freshmen, Fall 2017 cohort: 54.2%

Angelo & Jennette Volpe Library: The Volpe Library has more than 600,000 books (physical and digital) and access to nearly 90,000 journals through more than 100 databases to fuel academic research. The collection also includes more than 7,500 DVDs and CDs, more than 40,000 microfiche and microfilm items, and a substantial University Archive for historical research about Tech and the region. It is a Federal Depository for publications of the U.S. government.

Athletics

15 NCAA Division I teams, including men’s baseball, basketball, football, cross country, tennis and golf; and women’s basketball, beach volleyball, cross country, softball, soccer, track, volleyball and golf. The football team is in the Football Championship Subdivision and all teams belong to the Ohio Valley Conference.

Athletic Facilities

Hooper Eblen Center is a 9,852-seat arena that hosts volleyball, basketball and large campus events; two indoor tennis courts; a fitness center with a pool, handball courts, weight and meeting rooms. The Athletic Performance Center includes a 10,000-square foot turf practice field and a 10,000-square foot strength center. There are several practice fields, more than a dozen outdoor tennis courts, and an eight-lane track around Overall Field in Tucker Stadium, home to the football team.

Mascot: Awesome Eagle

The campus celebrates the beloved Awesome Eagle's birthday each year on February 14 with music, giveaways, cupcakes, and lots of fun! Awesome Eagle is a two-time, consecutive UCA National Championship title winner (2014-2015).
